Lewis Brindley
Datlof's Last Stand
+6 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Datlovian territory. -2 [ICON_Gold] per turn unit maintenance once the "Mercenaries" civic is discovered.
Land Hungry
Gains +1 [ICON_Strength] for all units at all times. Combat victories provide [ICON_Science] equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] of the defeated unit.
Gin Slinger
A Datlovian unique unit that replaces the slinger. Has +15 ranged [ICON_Strength], but - as slingers are quickly replaced - must be taken advantage of quickly.
XCOM Squad
A Datlovian unique unit that is unlocked with the "Nanotechnology" tech. Has 85 [ICON_Strength], ignores terrain/river crossing costs, and has 30 movement when starting a turn in friendly territory.
XCOM Terrain Cost
As a unique ability, XCOM Squads ignore terrain cost.
XCOM Crossing Rivers Cost
As a unique ability, XCOM Squads ignore crossing rivers cost.
XCOM Starting Turn Movement
As a unique ability, XCOM Squads gain 28 movement when starting a turn in friendly territory.
As a unique ability, XCOM Squads ignore terrain cost.
Gin Brewery
Where the mightiest gin in the world is made. Must be built in an encampment with a barracks and provides +3 [ICON_Culture] and +2 [ICON_GreatGeneral] per turn.
The mighty gin merchants of Datlof were forced to take up arms the only way they knew how when the Benians, Sjinians, and Parvians invaded. The gin slingers were the result.
Recognizing the potential threat from Giant Death Robots, aliens, and other external threats, the XCOM Initiative was born to protect the populace from enemies known, and unknown.
In these Datlovian breweries the strongest gin in the world was made. Even through Datlof's darkest hours, these unique structures remained relevant.
Republic of Datlof

Lewis Brindley's armies of gin warriors stood up to the greatest powers of the world. Although they eventually lost, they held out valiantly. Can you, Lewis Brindley, create a civilization to stand the test of time?
Chancellor
Chancellor
The first and last leader of the Republic of Datlof. Maintained Datlovian sovereignty through Datlof's darkest hours.
The mighty Republic of Datlof was a thorn in the world's side all the way up until it was defeated. Led by Lewis Brindley, it is well considered to be the greatest civilization of all time.
